results.title: Francis Bacon
results.creator_credit: David Hinton, RM Arts and London Weekend Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
This seminal documentary, edited and narrated by Melvyn Bragg remains one of the ‘stand out’ documentaries that surveys the life, work and motivations of British painter, Francis Bacon, through a series of interviews. Bacon, an extraordinary man, laconically introduces the relationship between broad formalist concerns and attempts to connect with the subconscious. Bacon articulates his response to images of a distressed humanity, revealing his deep fascination with the human body and its connection with much of Bacon’s life philosophies. Gritty in content, Bacon’s paintings reveal much of the ‘violence of life and death’ but seek to describe the normality of this with controlled sense of chaos, ‘capturing the moment’.

results.title: Francesco the potter (Greece)
results.creator_credit: Fred Harris, Paul Saltzman, Coronet Films and Sunrise Rilms
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
This film introduces a Greek boy who, while learning the skills of ceramics, makes a pair of cnadlesticks to present at a local church festival.

results.title: Francesco
results.creator_credit: Liliana Cavani, Roberta Cadringher, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Karol Film, Italnoleggio Cinematografica and Channel 1
results.brief_description: The story of St Francis of Assisi - a compassionate saint who shed a life of wealth and privilege to live as a humanitarian zealot, helping the poor and unwanted. Mickey Rouke plays Francis and Helena Bonham Carter is Chiara, the woman, and fellow convert, who loves him. After the defeat of Assisi by Perugia and spending a year in prison, Francesco is gradually awakened to the plight and suffering of the people, and to his religious calling. Despite the imploring of his distressed father, Francesco rejects his background and is driven to dispersing aid, by begging alms, and living amid the lepers and impoverished. The film relates Francis’ evolution, from a hedonistic merchant to a pious man of spiritual calling, told in flashback by his disciples. With an episodic structure, the film has grand intentions, and ably captures the aesthetics of the thirteenth century Italy but is laden with a rather portentous tone. Filmed on location in Perugia and Cincecitta and directed by Liliana Cavani (The Night porter, Ripley’s game).

results.title: Francesca baby
results.creator_credit: Larry S. Elikann, Martin Tahse and Martin Tahse Productions
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel of the same title by Joan L. Oppenheimer, about a teenage girl and her younger sister who try to cope with their alcoholic mother. Shows how the teenage girl joins Alateen and how a series of dramatic events mark the beginning of a new life for the girls.

results.title: Frances
results.creator_credit: Graeme Clifford, Jonathan Sanger, Brooksfilms and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: This is the story of Frances Farmer, whose troubled life made headlines in the 1930s. At 16, she was an award-winning high-school student in Seattle and at 23, a rising, provocative star of stage and screen, admired for her beauty and talent. At 27, a chain of relatively insignificant events led to her arrest and involuntary committal to a mental institution. Jessica Lange delivers a powerful, harrowing performance as the tormented Frances.

results.title: France: the Rhone Valley
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the varied physical, human and economic geography of the Rhone lowlands and emphasises the extent to which the people of this region are dependent on the river. The varied character of the relief, climate and agriculture of the enclosed plains south of Lyons, of the Carmargue, Languedoc and the Crau is shown in stages. The importance of the river as a source of irrigation water and power and the use of the valley as a transport route are stressed.

results.title: France: soaring with the senses. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Fast moving action and adventure as press attache Marie Francoise Guichard shows off the delights of France. Features a barge trip along the Canal du Midi, a journey by France’s latest triumph of technology to Corsica, a hot air balloon flight across the chateaux of the Loire Valley, Bastille Day celebrations in Paris with military parades and concerts, culminating in a climb up Mont Blanc and a parapente flight through the French Alps. Features characters such as Maurice Herzog and Paul Bocuse.

results.title: France: land and people
results.brief_description: An overview of France is presented in this video with a special emphasis on the variety of the French landscape and people. An exploration of Paris, the heart of France, illustrates the many contributions to world trade, research, development and education that France has produced.

results.title: France: background for literature
results.brief_description: Recaptures the France of the stories of Hugo, Balzac, Maupassant and Poe. Showing scenes in Paris, Versailles, Fountainbleau, Orleans, Chateau d’If, Marseilles and Normandy, the film provides a background for existing literature but does not attempt to recreate the actual scenes of stories.

results.title: France panorama. [Special edition. 14th July Parade]
results.brief_description: Special edition of France Panorama about Bastille Day, as it was celebrated from the turn of the 20th century to the current day. Traditionally it is a day for the French to celebrate the storming of the Bastille and a chance to demonstrate their military might. Includes archival news footage from the 1900s, 1930s and 1940s.
